oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cheekwood: Wemyss Gates
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1200 Forest Park Dr., Nashville, Davidson County, TN

Color photograph of the Wemyss Gates, conceived by Helen Peters Wemyss for her home in Nashville and executed by Philip Kerrigan, Jr. in 1931. They feature twelve bronze panels on each gate which represent 48 different botanical subjects. The panels across the bottom of the gates are iron with stylized cherry and apple blossom designs.

Cheekwood was designed by leading American landscape architect Bryant Fleming between 1929 and 1932. Although the estate was converted into a botanical garden and art museum beginning in 1959, the property boundaries contain the most significant elements of Fleming's original design, including the mansion and surrounding landscape features.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Botanical gardens
Gates
